item.title: How do you make a command a player can only use once?
item.dc:creator: @gman035t gman035t
item.description:
@gman035t wrote:

How would I make it save an integer to the moreinfo file, which I do have on my server?

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make a command a player can only use once?
item.dc:creator: @KiIIer KiIIer
item.description:
@KiIIer wrote:

declare:

public int name = 0;

make it save the int to your moreinfo file if you have one.

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("Command")){ if (name == 0){ name += 1; //the command..} if (name > 0){ sendMessage("You can only do Command one time.");}}

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make a command a player can only use once?
item.dc:creator: @funeboi56 funeboi56
item.description:
@funeboi56 wrote:

hey, iunno if this is Java or not, for i have no idea (so far) of how to “create” javascript, but i know how to “edit” it @_@

  1. create a boolean. boolean “used”
  2. find the command section.
  1. create a command, inside the brackets place this:

used = false; if(used == false){ *what it does* } else if(rawr != false){ sendmessage("only once, betch"); }

//Uhh, its not exactly correct, heck, dont even kno if its correct in general
@_@ im sorry, im currently learning.
